main.name: Mason McGinley
main.description: I am an extremely detail oriented person who loves combining my creativity and problem solving skills to create efficient, visually appealing websites and applications
main.bio: Hello, and welcome to my portfolio. My name is Mason McGinley. I'm currently a coding student for the University of Denver's Full Stack Coding Boot Camp. When I am not in school, I work full time as a broker at iTrade Colorado. I am a Colorado native, an avid basketball fan, and in my free time I enjoy the Colorado lifestyle by staying active with my pup Tucker. Currently I have leanred many languages in coding including but not limited to: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX, Node.js, Heroku, MYSQL, REACT.js, API's, and so much more! Please, take a moment to look at my portfolio page where you can see some of the various projects I have worked on, with the skills I have learned from the University of Denver. Or feel free to look at my GitHub page! If you have any questions, I can be reached by phone or email.
main.contactmessage: If I have caught your attention, please reach out to me!

resume.skillmessage: Here is a list of the web development technologies I am currently strongest with:

education.description: Studied numerous front end and back end coding languages, libraries, and programs in a 24 week long bootcamp.

education.degree: Associates Degree in Fire Science Technology
education.description: Studied how firefighting can be improved, and better managed for life saftey. Aspects of chemical combustion were anazlized and monitored to add life saftey data to current environmants. Wrote a case study paper that was submitted to the NFPA as a potential new way to approach residential dewling fires.

work.title: Broker
work.description: Is head of travel for the Colorado branch. Handling all travel requests for entire membership. Has exceeded all sales goals since starting, by an average of $10,000 a month. Has generated 1/3 of the branch sales with 1/4 of the client base. Has a higher monthly average per client than the nationwide standard. Developed and maintained strong knowledge of multiple products and varying levels of benefits within each product. Fostered positive business relationships to promote continued interest in barter products and services.

work.title: Leasing Agent
work.description: Met and exceeded all goals of complex for each month, from traffic to approved closes. Credit underwriting completed within company SOP, 48 hours at maximum. Able to build and maintain rapport based on trust and excellent customer service with prospective and existing clientele. Distributed and followed up on tenant renewal notices. Boosted occupancy 23% by leveraging market knowledge and successful promotional strategies. Was named best leasing agent of the year out of 27 new leasing agents.

work.title: Service Learning Coordinator
work.description: Handled all invoicing for the learning sector. Worked with accounting team to ensure all costs and profit is accounted for. Constructed various spreadsheets on performance and profitability outcomes for multiple projects. Attended and interfaced in weekly inter-company meetings, providing updates on all projects and assignments. Performed audits as needed. Responsible for tracking progress through a project's lifecycle to promote/enforce communication through the different branches within the company.

work.title: Center Director
work.description: Increased the student base by 300% in one year. Analyzed and provided assessments of programs for all new incoming students. Maintained communication between parents, instructors, and teachers. Upheld sound financial principles to keep program operating within budget levels, maximizing resource utilization while minimizing costs. Established and optimized program schedules to cover planned needs while capitalizing on opportunities to improve student learning. Modernized instructional plans and educational approaches to enhance student learning. Monitored social media and online sources for industry trends.

projects.title: Fitness
projects.category: A React.js app that allows a user to log int with authentication. Then help them track their fitness and health journey. It allows for workout entries, and meal entries giving the user the proper nutrients. It also offers access to YouTube for the user to be able to search for how to do specific workouts, and access to searching for new recipies to spice up their eating habits.

projects.title: BillBoards
projects.category: A Node.js applicaiton that allows users to create a budget, saves their budget, and offers guidance to amounts that should be used.

projects.title: Weather Trips
projects.category: A website that allows users to plan for an upcoming trip by showing weather at their stops along the way

projects.title: Day Planner
projects.category: A application that allows users to plan for their day. You can check off items once completed, or delete them entirely. This app will remember your schedule everytime you use it

projects.title: Note Taker
projects.category: A Note app that allows users to type in all the notes they possibly have. They can save, update, and delete all their notes.

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.category: An application that utilizes a 3rd party API that allows the user to search for a 5-day weather forecast for any city

projects.title: Offline Budget Tracker
projects.category: A budget tracker application that allows the user to add expenses and deposits to their budget with or without an internet connection.
